segments.text: I can't believe how careless that woman is being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she's just standing there, drying dishes like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she see the water all over the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, they're going to hurt themselves climbing up there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I mean, really, someone could slip and fall at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's completely oblivious to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I would never let my kitchen get into such a state.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to keep spilling out, making everything wet and slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those poor kids, they're just trying to get a snack and could end up getting hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in and take control of this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just not safe for anyone in here right now.
segments.speaker: PAR
